content.text:
# Austin Film Critics Association Awards 2015

11th AFCA Awards
----
Best Film:
Mad Max: Fury Road
The 11th Austin Film Critics Association Awards, honoring the best in filmmaking for 2015, were announced on December 29, 2015.
Winners and nominees
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Film
!style="width=50%"|Best Director
|-
| valign="top" |
# Mad Max: Fury Road
# Spotlight
# Carol
# Anomalisa
# Room
# Ex Machina
# Inside Out
# Creed
# The Big Short
# Sicario
| valign="top" |
* 'George Miller – Mad Max: Fury Road'
** Todd Haynes – Carol
** Tom McCarthy – Spotlight
** Adam McKay – The Big Short
** Quentin Tarantino – The Hateful Eight
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Actor
!style="width=50%"|Best Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Michael Fassbender – Steve Jobs'
** Bryan Cranston – Trumbo
** Leonardo DiCaprio – The Revenant
** Michael B. Jordan – Creed
** Jacob Tremblay – Room
| valign="top" |
* 'Brie Larson – Room'
** Cate Blanchett – Carol
** Rooney Mara – Carol
** Saoirse Ronan – Brooklyn
** Charlize Theron – Mad Max: Fury Road
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Supporting Actor
!style="width=50%"|Best Supporting Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Sylvester Stallone – Creed'
** Benicio del Toro – Sicario
** Idris Elba – Beasts of No Nation
** Oscar Isaac – Ex Machina
** Michael Shannon – 99 Homes
| valign="top" |
* 'Alicia Vikander – Ex Machina'
** Elizabeth Banks – Love and Mercy
** Jennifer Jason Leigh – The Hateful Eight
** Kristen Stewart – Clouds of Sils Maria
** Kate Winslet – Steve Jobs
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Original Screenplay
!style="width=50%"|Best Adapted Screenplay
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Inside Out – Pete Docter, Meg LeFauve, and Josh Cooley'
** Ex Machina – Alex Garland
** The Hateful Eight – Quentin Tarantino
** Sicario – Taylor Sheridan
** Spotlight – Tom McCarthy and Josh Singer
| valign="top" |
* 'Room – Emma Donoghue'
** Anomalisa – Charlie Kaufman
** The Big Short – Charles Randolph and Adam McKay
** Carol – Phyllis Nagy
** Steve Jobs – Aaron Sorkin
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Animated Film
!style="width=50%"|Best Foreign Language Film
|-
| valign="top" |
* Inside Out
** Anomalisa
** The Good Dinosaur
** The Peanuts Movie
** Shaun the Sheep Movie
| valign="top" |
* Son of Saul
** Mustang
** Phoenix
** The Tribe
** Victoria
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best First Film
!style="width=50%"|Best Documentary
|-
| valign="top" |
* Ex Machina
** Bone Tomahawk
** The Diary of a Teenage Girl
** Mustang
** Son of Saul
| valign="top" |
* The Look of Silence
** Amy
** Best of Enemies
** Cartel Land
** Where to Invade Next
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Cinematography
!style="width=50%"|Best Score
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Carol – Edward Lachman'
** The Hateful Eight – Robert Richardson
** Mad Max: Fury Road – John Seale
** The Revenant – Emmanuel Lubezki
** Sicario – Roger Deakins
| valign="top" |
* 'The Hateful Eight – Ennio Morricone'
** Carol – Carter Burwell
** Inside Out – Michael Giacchino
** It Follows – Disasterpeace
** Mad Max: Fury Road – Junkie XL
|-
!style="width=50%"|Bobby McCurdy Memorial Breakthrough Artist Award
!style="width=50%"| Austin Film Award
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Jacob Tremblay – Room'
** Abraham Attah – Beasts of No Nation
** Amy Schumer – Trainwreck
** Mya Taylor – Tangerine
** Alicia Vikander – Ex Machina
| valign="top" |
* 'Kumiko, the Treasure Hunter – David Zellner'
** Arlo and Julie – Steve Mims
** A Brave Heart: The Lizzie Velasquez Story – Sara Hirsh Bordo
** Peace Officer – Brad Barber and Scott Christopherson
** Two Step – Alex R. Johnson
|-
! colspan="2" | Special Honorary Award
|-
| colspan=2 valign="top" width="50%"|
* Don Hertzfeldt, in celebration of a career of remarkable short filmmaking and contributions to animation spanning two decades, with 2015's award-winning World of Tomorrow being recognized as his best work to date
|}
